meanings.definition: To surround with a rampart or fortification.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers will circumvallate the castle to protect it from enemies.
meanings.sent2: The builders will circumvallate the entire area with a strong wall.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to circumvallate their anthill with tiny pebbles for extra security.
meanings.sent4: The chef will circumvallate the cake with a layer of frosting for decoration.
meanings.sent5: The students will circumvallate their project with colorful borders to make it stand out.

meanings.definition: Having a raised edge or margin, as certain leaves.
meanings.sent1: The circumvallate leaves of the plant helped it stand out in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The book had a beautiful cover with circumvallate patterns along the edges.
meanings.sent3: The cat's circumvallate tail looked like a fluffy feather duster.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak was surrounded by circumvallate clouds, creating a majestic sight.
meanings.sent5: The cake was decorated with circumvallate icing swirls that added a touch of elegance.
